title: About Me
text:
My Journey
My interest in bioinformatics emerged from a fascination with how computational approaches can decode biological complexity. With a foundation in biomedical sciences and genomics, I‚Äôm now focused on building strong programming and data analysis skills to bridge wet-lab biology and computational research.
I‚Äôm working through bioinformatics problem sets, building analysis pipelines, and documenting my learning journey through this portfolio. My background includes teaching experience in gymnastics and education, which has strengthened my ability to break down complex concepts and communicate effectively.

title: About Me
text:
Technical Skills
Programming Languages - Python (primary focus for bioinformatics) - R (statistical analysis and visualization) - Bash/Shell scripting - SQL for database querying
Bioinformatics Tools & Platforms - Git/GitHub for version control - Linux/WSL development environment - Quarto for reproducible research - Data analysis libraries (pandas, NumPy, BioPython)
Computational Biology - Sequence analysis algorithms - Statistical methods for genomics - Data visualization - Pipeline development

title: About Me
text:
Interests Beyond Science
When I‚Äôm not coding or analyzing data, I enjoy: - Philosophy: Exploring existential questions and Taoist thought - Competitive Yu-Gi-Oh: Strategy and deck building - Writing: Working on a book project - Film: Action and tactical/espionage genres - Music: Gregorian chants and instrumental compositions

title: About Me
text:
What‚Äôs Next
I‚Äôm actively seeking opportunities in bioinformatics, computational biology, or data science where I can apply my growing technical skills and contribute to meaningful research. I‚Äôm particularly interested in genomics, algorithm development, and data-driven biological discovery.
Open to: Full-time positions, internships, collaborations, and freelance projects

title: Cody Geoffroy
text:

title: Research
text:
Research Interests
My research interests focus on:

Genomics: Understanding genetic variation and its functional implications
Computational Biology: Developing algorithms for biological data analysis
Bioinformatics: Building pipelines for high-throughput data processing
Systems Biology: Integrating multi-omics data to understand biological systems

I‚Äôm interested in opportunities to apply computational methods to genomic research and contribute to data-driven biological discovery.
